messages.message: Also, does anyone have experience with classifying docs between 100s of classes?
If you do, Citi would appreciate some anecdotes and tips
no, but i have experience classifying faces between tens of thousands of faces :slightly_smiling_face:. not sure if that counts…
what are they having trouble with? just that performance isn’t where it could be?

Basically our base classifier structure only works well for splitting between 10-15 classes. I think the issue is more like "how do we write the classifier code on Instabase to achieve this splitting" rather than "is it possible"
i.e. we have custom classifier and ensemble classifier capabilities, but I have not seen an example of these being used in a hierarchical manner
ah got it. yea i haven’t either.

Didn't someone create a UDF or something that took cluster and than created a bunch of folders structures to create the classifier? I remember at Cap1 we have a doc set of 10's of thousands. The cluster pulled like 100 or so cluster and the UDF made a folder structure and put the files in it to then go on to train a classifier
not that this is 1:1 but rememeber something along the lines of training a classifier for a lot more
That would be beautiful, I was recommending to them that they might want to try something along those lines
I think Frank Wang did it, not sure if anyone managed to take it... or if someone has a C1 laptop and can log into Franks demo repo's I think its in there :wink: I think @Ted knows this one better
or maybe it was an internal one only
haha no problem, I mean validation that this sort of approach will actually work / has been done is enough, we can build a similar UDF
